intro: Rondeletia wendtii, commonly known as the Brazilian flame flower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its vibrant red or orange tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a velvety texture. The flowers are pollinated by birds, particularly hummingbirds, due to their nectar-rich structure and bright coloration.
